title: [K-12] Gamification-Based Mobile Blood Circulation Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental human tissue and cell structures
context.additional_context: A process where learners explore blood circulation mechanisms using gamified content on personal mobile devices. Mobile app-based activities integrated with real-time video conferencing systems

learning_goals: Explain the main organs (heart, blood vessels, lungs) and processes of blood circulation using accurate terminology
Distinguish the components and functions of blood (red blood cells, white blood cells, platelets, plasma) through game missions
Analyze the differences between pulmonary and systemic circulation with over 80% accuracy using simulated experiment modules
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
